item.content:encoded:
about us

WHO ARE WE?

Asili Uhai Afrika (AUA) is a non-governmental organization based in Nanyuki, Kenya, dedicated to restoring Africa's natural environment through impactful reforestation and afforestation projects. Founded by Fiona Koome and Uwe Baumgrtner, a ranger and forester, AUA partners with local communities to plant and nurture native tree species, ensuring biodiversity and sustainability. Our mission goes beyond planting trees we empower communities through agroforestry, sustainable development, and environmental education, contributing to global goals such as combating climate change, reducing poverty, and promoting sustainable livelihoods. At AUA, we believe in harnessing local expertise to create a greener, healthier future for Africa and the world.

1. Mission and Impact

At AUA, our mission is to provide significant natural value to the community by following high standards in forestry. We focus on planting local and native tree species with optimal survival rates. Currently, our initiatives aim to plant as many trees as posible each rainy season. Our planting activities not only enhance biodiversity but also create economic opportunities through agroforestry, benefiting local farmers.

It took many people hundreds of hours of work, and lots of love, to make this template and tutorial possible.

I sincerely hope this helps you make a website that you can be truly proud of!

But your comments on our videos, like the one you can see below, make it all worth it. Thank you so much!

Astrid Hartman

Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Ut elit tellus, luctus nec ullamcorper mattis, pulvinar dapibus leo.

Excellent tutorial, one of the best I've seen and I sorely needed this step-by-step instruction. Thank you!

What My Clients Say

item.title: Sample Page
item.dc:creator: m@anuu
item.content:encoded:
This is an example page. It's different from a blog post because it will stay in one place and will show up in your site navigation (in most themes). Most people start with an About page that introduces them to potential site visitors. It might say something like this:

Hi there! I'm a bike messenger by day, aspiring actor by night, and this is my website. I live in Los Angeles, have a great dog named Jack, and I like piña coladas. (And gettin' caught in the rain.)

...or something like this:

The XYZ Doohickey Company was founded in 1971, and has been providing quality doohickeys to the public ever since. Located in Gotham City, XYZ employs over 2,000 people and does all kinds of awesome things for the Gotham community.

As a new WordPress user, you should go to your dashboard to delete this page and create new pages for your content. Have fun!

item.title: Privacy Policy
item.dc:creator: m@anuu
item.content:encoded:
Who we are

Suggested text: Our website address is: http://localhost/wordpress.

Comments

Suggested text: When visitors leave comments on the site we collect the data shown in the comments form, and also the visitor’s IP address and browser user agent string to help spam detection.

An anonymized string created from your email address (also called a hash) may be provided to the Gravatar service to see if you are using it. The Gravatar service privacy policy is available here: https://automattic.com/privacy/. After approval of your comment, your profile picture is visible to the public in the context of your comment.

Media

Suggested text: If you upload images to the website, you should avoid uploading images with embedded location data (EXIF GPS) included. Visitors to the website can download and extract any location data from images on the website.

Cookies

Suggested text: If you leave a comment on our site you may opt-in to saving your name, email address and website in cookies. These are for your convenience so that you do not have to fill in your details again when you leave another comment. These cookies will last for one year.

If you visit our login page, we will set a temporary cookie to determine if your browser accepts cookies. This cookie contains no personal data and is discarded when you close your browser.

When you log in, we will also set up several cookies to save your login information and your screen display choices. Login cookies last for two days, and screen options cookies last for a year. If you select "Remember Me", your login will persist for two weeks. If you log out of your account, the login cookies will be removed.

If you edit or publish an article, an additional cookie will be saved in your browser. This cookie includes no personal data and simply indicates the post ID of the article you just edited. It expires after 1 day.

Embedded content from other websites

Suggested text: Articles on this site may include embedded content (e.g. videos, images, articles, etc.). Embedded content from other websites behaves in the exact same way as if the visitor has visited the other website.

These websites may collect data about you, use cookies, embed additional third-party tracking, and monitor your interaction with that embedded content, including tracking your interaction with the embedded content if you have an account and are logged in to that website.

Who we share your data with

Suggested text: If you request a password reset, your IP address will be included in the reset email.

How long we retain your data

Suggested text: If you leave a comment, the comment and its metadata are retained indefinitely. This is so we can recognize and approve any follow-up comments automatically instead of holding them in a moderation queue.

For users that register on our website (if any), we also store the personal information they provide in their user profile. All users can see, edit, or delete their personal information at any time (except they cannot change their username). Website administrators can also see and edit that information.

What rights you have over your data

Suggested text: If you have an account on this site, or have left comments, you can request to receive an exported file of the personal data we hold about you, including any data you have provided to us. You can also request that we erase any personal data we hold about you. This does not include any data we are obliged to keep for administrative, legal, or security purposes.

Where your data is sent

Suggested text: Visitor comments may be checked through an automated spam detection service.

item.title: Home
item.dc:creator: m@anuu
item.content:encoded:
ASILI UHAI AFRIKA

Donate

Asili Uhai Afrika (AUA), We are dedicated to restoring Africas natural environment through tree planting and agroforestry initiatives, empowering local communities, and creating sustainable ecosystems.

Mission Statement

We are dedicated to restoring Africas natural environment through tree planting and agroforestry initiatives, empowering local communities, and creating sustainable ecosystems.

Current Projects

  • Tree planting drives
  • Community training in agroforestry
  • University and local collaborations

Environmental and Social Impact

Why Tree Planting Matters?

Tree planting plays a crucial role in global environmental sustainability, biodiversity preservation, and strengthening community resilience. By planting trees,AUA contributes to:

  • Carbon Sequestration: Trees absorb carbon dioxide from the atmosphere, helping mitigate the effects of climate change. Each tree can sequester a significant amount of carbon over its lifetime, reducing greenhouse gas emissions.
  • Soil Preservation: Trees help prevent soil erosion by stabilizing the soil with their root systems, reducing the risk of landslides, and preserving the fertility of agricultural lands.
  • Water Cycle Regulation: Forests contribute to the water cycle by helping with rainfall formation and regulating water flow, reducing the risk of floods and droughts in local communities.
  • Improved Air Quality: By absorbing pollutants and releasing oxygen, trees improve the air quality, benefiting both ecosystems and human health.

Partnership & Collaboration

AUA recognizes the importance of collaboration in achieving its mission and maximizing its impact. Through strategic partnerships, we are able to leverage resources, knowledge, and networks that enhance our tree planting and agroforestry initiatives. Here are some key partnerships:

1. Universities

Collaboration with Academic Institutions: AUA partners with various universities to engage students and faculty in research, training, and fieldwork related to tree planting and environmental conservation. These partnerships not only provide valuable academic insights but also create opportunities for students to participate in hands-on projects that benefit local communities.

Internship and Volunteer Opportunities: Students are invited to volunteer in tree planting activities and receive practical training in agroforestry practices, promoting a deeper understanding of environmental issues and sustainable solutions.

2. Local Communities

Community Engagement: AUA actively collaborates with local communities to identify areas for tree planting and to tailor initiatives that meet their specific needs. By involving community members from the start, AUA ensures that projects are culturally relevant and have local support.

Capacity Building: Through workshops and training sessions, AUA empowers local farmers and community leaders with knowledge about sustainable farming, biodiversity conservation, and agroforestry techniques. This involvement fosters ownership and commitment to long-term environmental stewardship.

3. Non-Governmental Organizations (NGOs)

Collaboration with Other NGOs: AUA partners with other environmental NGOs to amplify efforts in reforestation and sustainable land management. These collaborations help pool resources and expertise to tackle larger projects that have a broader impact.

4. Government Agencies

Policy Advocacy and Support: AUA works alongside government agencies to align its initiatives with national environmental policies and regulations. This partnership helps in securing necessary permits and support for large-scale tree planting efforts.

Impact

''Climate Change knows no boarder''

Empowering Communities Through Reforestation:

A local woman planting a native tree, symbolizing hope, sustainability, and the commitment to restoring Africa's natural beauty.

Together for a Greener Future:

Community members uniting to plant native trees, showcasing the collective effort to restore ecosystems and combat climate change.

Planting Seeds of Change:

A collaborative effort as two individuals work together to nurture the environment and inspire sustainable practices.

Uwe Baumgrtners

Working alongside Asili Uhai Afrika has been a rewarding journey. Through our collective efforts, we are not just planting trees but building sustainable futures for communities. The vision and commitment to reforestation and biodiversity that this organization fosters have truly been inspiring. I am proud to be part of this impactful mission

What Our Partners Say

Tree Nursery

Nurturing Life the Heart of Reforestation at our Tree Nursery

Nurturing Life
The heart of Reforestation at Our Tree Nursery,

At the core of Asili Uhai Afrikas reforestation efforts is our dedicated tree nursery, where native tree seedlings are carefully nurtured to thrive in their natural habitats. Each seed planted is more than just a step towards ecological restorationits a promise to combat the devastating effects of deforestation, soil erosion, and climate change. These seedlings, grown with love and care by our local communities, are crucial in restoring Africas landscapes, supporting biodiversity, and promoting sustainable land use. By raising these trees locally, we ensure they are well-suited to their environment, while also providing communities with the knowledge and resources to engage in sustainable farming and forestry practices. The nursery plays a vital role in our mission, as it not only serves as the foundation for the trees planted across the region but also as a space where communities learn the importance of environmental stewardship. Through this initiative, Asili Uhai Afrika aims to leave a lasting legacy of green spaces, cleaner air, and thriving ecosystems that benefit both the planet and the people who call it home.

Environmental and Social Impact

Why Tree Planting Matters?

Tree planting plays a crucial role in global environmental sustainability, biodiversity preservation, and strengthening community resilience. By planting trees, AUA contributes to:

  • Carbon Sequestration: Trees absorb carbon dioxide from the atmosphere, helping mitigate the effects of climate change. Each tree can sequester a significant amount of carbon over its lifetime, reducing greenhouse gas emissions.
  • Soil Preservation: Trees help prevent soil erosion by stabilizing the soil with their root systems, reducing the risk of landslides, and preserving the fertility of agricultural lands.
  • Water Cycle Regulation: Forests contribute to the water cycle by helping with rainfall formation and regulating water flow, reducing the risk of floods and droughts in local communities.
  • Improved Air Quality: By absorbing pollutants and releasing oxygen, trees improve the air quality, benefiting both ecosystems and human health.

Partnership & Collaboration

AUA recognizes the importance of collaboration in achieving its mission and maximizing its impact. Through strategic partnerships, we are able to leverage resources, knowledge, and networks that enhance our tree planting and agroforestry initiatives. Here are some key partnerships:

1. Universities

Collaboration with Academic Institutions: AUA partners with various universities to engage students and faculty in research, training, and fieldwork related to tree planting and environmental conservation. These partnerships not only provide valuable academic insights but also create opportunities for students to participate in hands-on projects that benefit local communities.

Internship and Volunteer Opportunities: Students are invited to volunteer in tree planting activities and receive practical training in agroforestry practices, promoting a deeper understanding of environmental issues and sustainable solutions.

2. Local Communities

Community Engagement: AUA actively collaborates with local communities to identify areas for tree planting and to tailor initiatives that meet their specific needs. By involving community members from the start, AUA ensures that projects are culturally relevant and have local support.

Capacity Building: Through workshops and training sessions, AUA empowers local farmers and community leaders with knowledge about sustainable farming, biodiversity conservation, and agroforestry techniques. This involvement fosters ownership and commitment to long-term environmental stewardship.

3. Non-Governmental Organizations (NGOs)

Collaboration with Other NGOs: AUA partners with other environmental NGOs to amplify efforts in reforestation and sustainable land management. These collaborations help pool resources and expertise to tackle larger projects that have a broader impact.

4. Government Agencies

Policy Advocacy and Support: AUA works alongside government agencies to align its initiatives with national environmental policies and regulations. This partnership helps in securing necessary permits and support for large-scale tree planting efforts.

At the core of Asili Uhai Afrika’s reforestation efforts is our dedicated tree nursery, where native tree seedlings are carefully nurtured to thrive in their natural habitats. Each seed planted is more than just a step towards ecological restoration—it’s a promise to combat the devastating effects of deforestation, soil erosion, and climate change. These seedlings, grown with love and care by our local communities, are crucial in restoring Africa’s landscapes, supporting biodiversity, and promoting sustainable land use. By raising these trees locally, we ensure they are well-suited to their environment, while also providing communities with the knowledge and resources to engage in sustainable farming and forestry practices. The nursery plays a vital role in our mission, as it not only serves as the foundation for the trees planted across the region but also as a space where communities learn the importance of environmental stewardship. Through this initiative, Asili Uhai Afrika aims to leave a lasting legacy of green spaces, cleaner air, and thriving ecosystems that benefit both the planet and the people who call it home.

ASILI UHAI AFRIKA

Donate

Asili Uhai Afrika (AUA), We are dedicated to restoring Africa’s natural environment through tree planting and agroforestry initiatives, empowering local communities, and creating sustainable ecosystems.

Mission Statement 

We are dedicated to restoring Africa’s natural environment through tree planting and agroforestry initiatives, empowering local communities, and creating sustainable ecosystems.

Current Projects

  • Tree planting drives
  • Community training in agroforestry
  • University and local collaborations

Environmental and Social Impact

Why Tree Planting Matters?

Tree planting plays a crucial role in global environmental sustainability, biodiversity preservation, and strengthening community resilience. By planting trees, AUA contributes to:

  • Carbon Sequestration: Trees absorb carbon dioxide from the atmosphere, helping mitigate the effects of climate change. Each tree can sequester a significant amount of carbon over its lifetime, reducing greenhouse gas emissions.
  • Soil Preservation: Trees help prevent soil erosion by stabilizing the soil with their root systems, reducing the risk of landslides, and preserving the fertility of agricultural lands.
  • Water Cycle Regulation: Forests contribute to the water cycle by helping with rainfall formation and regulating water flow, reducing the risk of floods and droughts in local communities.
  • Improved Air Quality: By absorbing pollutants and releasing oxygen, trees improve the air quality, benefiting both ecosystems and human health.

Partnership & Collaboration

AUA recognizes the importance of collaboration in achieving its mission and maximizing its impact. Through strategic partnerships, we are able to leverage resources, knowledge, and networks that enhance our tree planting and agroforestry initiatives. Here are some key partnerships:

1. Universities

Collaboration with Academic Institutions: AUA partners with various universities to engage students and faculty in research, training, and fieldwork related to tree planting and environmental conservation. These partnerships not only provide valuable academic insights but also create opportunities for students to participate in hands-on projects that benefit local communities.

Internship and Volunteer Opportunities: Students are invited to volunteer in tree planting activities and receive practical training in agroforestry practices, promoting a deeper understanding of environmental issues and sustainable solutions.

2. Local Communities

Community Engagement: AUA actively collaborates with local communities to identify areas for tree planting and to tailor initiatives that meet their specific needs. By involving community members from the start, AUA ensures that projects are culturally relevant and have local support.

Capacity Building: Through workshops and training sessions, AUA empowers local farmers and community leaders with knowledge about sustainable farming, biodiversity conservation, and agroforestry techniques. This involvement fosters ownership and commitment to long-term environmental stewardship.

3. Non-Governmental Organizations (NGOs)

Collaboration with Other NGOs: AUA partners with other environmental NGOs to amplify efforts in reforestation and sustainable land management. These collaborations help pool resources and expertise to tackle larger projects that have a broader impact.

4. Government Agencies

Policy Advocacy and Support: AUA works alongside government agencies to align its initiatives with national environmental policies and regulations. This partnership helps in securing necessary permits and support for large-scale tree planting efforts.

Impact

”Climate Change knows no boarder”

Empowering Communities Through Reforestation:

A local woman planting a native tree, symbolizing hope, sustainability, and the commitment to restoring Africa's natural beauty.

Together for a Greener Future:

Community members uniting to plant native trees, showcasing the collective effort to restore ecosystems and combat climate change.

Planting Seeds of Change:

A collaborative effort as two individuals work together to nurture the environment and inspire sustainable practices.

Uwe Baumgärtner’s

Working alongside Asili Uhai Afrika has been a rewarding journey. Through our collective efforts, we are not just planting trees but building sustainable futures for communities. The vision and commitment to reforestation and biodiversity that this organization fosters have truly been inspiring. I am proud to be part of this impactful mission

What Our Partners Say

Tree Nursery

Nurturing Life the Heart of Reforestation at our Tree Nursery

Nurturing Life
The heart of Reforestation at Our Tree Nursery,

At the core of Asili Uhai Afrika’s reforestation efforts is our dedicated tree nursery, where native tree seedlings are carefully nurtured to thrive in their natural habitats. Each seed planted is more than just a step towards ecological restoration—it’s a promise to combat the devastating effects of deforestation, soil erosion, and climate change. These seedlings, grown with love and care by our local communities, are crucial in restoring Africa’s landscapes, supporting biodiversity, and promoting sustainable land use. By raising these trees locally, we ensure they are well-suited to their environment, while also providing communities with the knowledge and resources to engage in sustainable farming and forestry practices. The nursery plays a vital role in our mission, as it not only serves as the foundation for the trees planted across the region but also as a space where communities learn the importance of environmental stewardship. Through this initiative, Asili Uhai Afrika aims to leave a lasting legacy of green spaces, cleaner air, and thriving ecosystems that benefit both the planet and the people who call it home.

Donate
Contact Us

Join Us in Restoring Our Planet:
Support Asili Uhai Afrika’s reforestation efforts by donating or volunteering today. Together, we can make a lasting impact on our environment and communities.

Get In Touch

''Make a Difference Today''

Donate

item.title: About
item.dc:creator: m@anuu
item.content:encoded:
About Us

WHO ARE WE?

Asili Uhai Afrika (AUA) is a non-governmental organization based in Nanyuki, Kenya, dedicated to restoring Africa's natural environment through impactful reforestation and afforestation projects. Founded by Fiona Koome and Uwe Baumgrtner, a ranger and forester, AUA partners with local communities to plant and nurture native tree species, ensuring biodiversity and sustainability. Our mission goes beyond planting trees we empower communities through agroforestry, sustainable development, and environmental education, contributing to global goals such as combating climate change, reducing poverty, and promoting sustainable livelihoods. At AUA, we believe in harnessing local expertise to create a greener, healthier future for Africa and the world.

Planting the Seeds of Change

Asili Uhai Afrika is a dedicated organization committed to restoring Africas natural ecosystems through impactful reforestation projects. This tree symbolizes our missionnurturing life, fostering biodiversity, and empowering communities to thrive in harmony with nature. Together, were creating a greener, sustainable future for all.

Mission and Impact

At AUA, our mission is to provide significant natural value to the community by following high standards in forestry. We focus on planting local and native tree species with optimal survival rates. Currently, our initiatives aim to plant as many trees as posible each rainy season. Our planting activities not only enhance biodiversity but also create economic opportunities through agroforestry, benefiting local farmers.

Partnerships and Collaboration

AUA actively collaborates with universities, local communities, and other organizations to foster sustainable development. We engage students and faculty in our projects, providing opportunities for hands-on experience in environmental stewardship. Our partnerships facilitate knowledge sharing and resource mobilization, amplifying our impact on reforestation efforts.

Challenges and Solutions

While our NGO faces challenges in seedling transport and ensuring community involvement, we have devised effective solutions:

  • Seedling Transport: Farmers play a crucial role in transporting seedlings to project sites, adapting to local circumstances.
  • Community Involvement: Local residents are involved from the planning phase, fostering ownership and ensuring successful implementation. Regular inspections by neighboring villages ensure long-term accountability and maintenance of reforested areas.

Environmental and Social Impact

Our initiatives significantly contribute to environmental sustainability by restoring ecosystems and promoting biodiversity. The social aspect of our projects emphasizes community engagement, increasing local acceptance of environmental interventions and enhancing livelihoods.

Future Goals and Vision

AUA envisions a future where reforestation and sustainable land management practices are the norm. Our long-term goals include expanding our planting initiatives and further integrating agroforestry to provide additional food sources and economic stability for local populations.

Funding and Support

Our projects are funded through donations, partnerships, and grants. To achieve our goals, we seek ongoing support in the form of financial contributions, resources, and expertise from individuals and organizations passionate about environmental sustainability.

Personal Involvement and Motivation

The driving force behind AUA is our commitment to creating a healthier planet and empowered communities. The rewarding aspect of our work lies in witnessing the transformative impact of our initiatives, as local communities actively participate in shaping their environment and improving their livelihoods.

Fiona Koome

Working with Fiona Koome and the team at Asili Uhai Afrika has been an incredible journey. Their commitment to environmental restoration and community empowerment is unmatched. Through their efforts, we have seen firsthand the positive impact of reforestation on local livelihoods and ecosystems.

What Our Partners Say

Change<\/b>","align":"center","typography_typography":"custom","typography_font_size":{"unit":"px","size":48,"sizes":[]},"typography_font_size_tablet":{"unit":"px","size":38,"sizes":[]},"typography_font_size_mobile":{"unit":"px","size":29,"sizes":[]},"typography_line_height_tablet":{"unit":"px","size":62,"sizes":[]},"typography_line_height_mobile":{"unit":"px","size":44,"sizes":[]},"typography_letter_spacing":{"unit":"px","size":-1,"sizes":[]},"_padding_tablet":{"unit":"%","top":"0","right":"14","bottom":"0","left":"14","isLinked":false},"_padding_mobile":{"unit":"%","top":"0","right":"0","bottom":"0","left":"0","isLinked":true},"motion_fx_motion_fx_scrolling":"yes"},"elements":[],"widgetType":"heading"},{"id":"904d267","elType":"widget","settings":{"editor":"

Asili Uhai Afrika is a dedicated organization committed to restoring Africa\u2019s natural ecosystems through impactful reforestation projects. This tree symbolizes our mission\u2014nurturing life, fostering biodiversity, and empowering communities to thrive in harmony with nature. Together, we\u2019re creating a greener, sustainable future for all.<\/p>","column_gap":{"unit":"px","size":0,"sizes":[]},"motion_fx_motion_fx_scrolling":"yes"},"elements":[],"widgetType":"text-editor"},{"id":"a80dab4","elType":"widget","settings":{"editor":"

Mission and Impact<\/b><\/span><\/p>

At AUA, our mission is to provide significant natural value to the community by following high standards in forestry. We focus on planting local and native tree species with optimal survival rates. Currently, our initiatives aim to plant as many trees as posible each rainy season. Our planting activities not only enhance biodiversity but also create economic opportunities through agroforestry, benefiting local farmers.<\/span><\/p>

\u00a0<\/span><\/p>

Partnerships and Collaboration<\/b><\/span><\/p>

AUA actively collaborates with universities, local communities, and other organizations to foster sustainable development. We engage students and faculty in our projects, providing opportunities for hands-on experience in environmental stewardship. Our partnerships facilitate knowledge sharing and resource mobilization, amplifying our impact on reforestation efforts.<\/span><\/p>

\u00a0<\/span><\/p>

Challenges and Solutions<\/b><\/span><\/p>

While our NGO faces challenges in seedling transport and ensuring community involvement, we have devised effective solutions:<\/span><\/p>

\u00a0<\/span><\/p>

  • Seedling Transport: Farmers play a crucial role in transporting seedlings to project sites, adapting to local circumstances.<\/span><\/li>
  • Community Involvement: Local residents are involved from the planning phase, fostering ownership and ensuring successful implementation. Regular inspections by neighboring villages ensure long-term accountability and maintenance of reforested areas.<\/span><\/li><\/ul>

    \u00a0<\/span><\/p>

    Environmental and Social Impact<\/b><\/span><\/p>

    Our initiatives significantly contribute to environmental sustainability by restoring ecosystems and promoting biodiversity. The social aspect of our projects emphasizes community engagement, increasing local acceptance of environmental interventions and enhancing livelihoods.<\/span><\/p>

    \u00a0<\/span><\/p>

    Future Goals and Vision<\/b><\/span><\/p>

    AUA envisions a future where reforestation and sustainable land management practices are the norm. Our long-term goals include expanding our planting initiatives and further integrating agroforestry to provide additional food sources and economic stability for local populations.<\/span><\/p>

    \u00a0<\/span><\/p>

    Funding and Support<\/b><\/span><\/p>

    Our projects are funded through donations, partnerships, and grants. To achieve our goals, we seek ongoing support in the form of financial contributions, resources, and expertise from individuals and organizations passionate about environmental sustainability.<\/span><\/p>

    \u00a0<\/span><\/p>

    Personal Involvement and Motivation<\/b><\/span><\/p>

    The driving force behind AUA is our commitment to creating a healthier planet and empowered communities. The rewarding aspect of our work lies in witnessing the transformative impact of our initiatives, as local communities actively participate in shaping their environment and improving their livelihoods.<\/span><\/p>","motion_fx_motion_fx_scrolling":"yes"},"elements":[],"widgetType":"text-editor"}],"isInner":true},{"id":"07afb6e","elType":"container","settings":{"flex_direction":"column","content_width":"full","width":{"unit":"%","size":37},"flex_gap":{"column":"0","row":"0","isLinked":true,"unit":"px","size":0},"margin":{"unit":"px","top":"0","right":"0","bottom":"0","left":"0","isLinked":false},"padding":{"unit":"px","top":"10","right":"10","bottom":"10","left":"10","isLinked":true},"width_tablet":{"unit":"%","size":100,"sizes":[]},"width_mobile":{"unit":"%","size":"","sizes":[]},"_flex_align_self_tablet":"center","padding_mobile":{"unit":"px","top":"0","right":"0","bottom":"0","left":"0","isLinked":false},"padding_tablet":{"unit":"px","top":"0","right":"0","bottom":"0","left":"0","isLinked":true},"_flex_order_tablet":"end"},"elements":[{"id":"83930a5","elType":"widget","settings":{"image":{"id":4364,"url":"http:\/\/localhost\/wordpress\/wp-content\/uploads\/2024\/12\/WhatsApp-Image-2024-12-19-at-12.38.35-PM.jpeg","alt":"","source":"library","size":""},"image_size":"full","image_border_radius":{"unit":"px","top":"6","right":"6","bottom":"6","left":"6","isLinked":true},"height":{"unit":"px","size":540,"sizes":[]},"object-fit":"cover","width":{"unit":"%","size":100,"sizes":[]},"object-position":"bottom item.title: Projects
item.dc:creator: m@anuu
item.content:encoded:
Projects

From $2

Leaders in Action

Reforestation efforts

Community chiefs leading by example in reforestation efforts. Their active participation reflects the importance of local leadership in fostering environmental sustainability and inspiring communities to join the fight against deforestation. Together, we are planting a legacy of hope and renewal for future generations.

Donate
From $2

Planting together for greener tommorow

Restoring Environment

Two individuals working hand in hand to restore the environment, showcasing the power of collaboration and shared responsibility. Every tree planted brings us one step closer to a healthier planet and a sustainable future for all

Donate
From $2

United for Greener Future

A remarkable group of over 30 individuals coming together to take action for the environment. This collective tree-planting effort symbolizes the power of unity and shared responsibility in combating the effects of deforestation and climate change. Each tree planted represents hope, resilience, and the promise of a restored ecosystem that will benefit future generations. Through teamwork and dedication, these individuals are not just planting trees but laying the foundation for a sustainable future. Their efforts remind us that real change begins with people, and together, we can create a healthier, greener world for all.

Donate

Work with us

Send us a message to discuss your needs. I always reply within 24 hours.

Donate

Contact Us

Email: asiliuhaiafrika@gmail.com

Phone: +491749735601 | +254720828560

Location: P.O. Box 62-10 400 Nanyuki, Kenya

{"timeout":1735026439,"value":{"content":"

Projects

From $2

Leaders in Action

Reforestation efforts

Community chiefs leading by example in reforestation efforts. Their active participation reflects the importance of local leadership in fostering environmental sustainability and inspiring communities to join the fight against deforestation. Together, we are planting a legacy of hope and renewal for future generations.

Donate
From $2

Planting together for greener tommorow

Restoring Environment 

Two individuals working hand in hand to restore the environment, showcasing the power of collaboration and shared responsibility. Every tree planted brings us one step closer to a healthier planet and a sustainable future for all

Donate
From $2

United for Greener Future

A remarkable group of over 30 individuals coming together to take action for the environment. This collective tree-planting effort symbolizes the power of unity and shared responsibility in combating the effects of deforestation and climate change. Each tree planted represents hope, resilience, and the promise of a restored ecosystem that will benefit future generations. Through teamwork and dedication, these individuals are not just planting trees but laying the foundation for a sustainable future. Their efforts remind us that real change begins with people, and together, we can create a healthier, greener world for all.

Donate

Work with us

Send us a message to discuss your needs. I always reply within 24 hours.

Donate

Contact Us

Email: asiliuhaiafrika@gmail.com

Phone: +491749735601 | +254720828560

Location: P.O. Box 62-10 400 Nanyuki, Kenya

Contact Us

We respond to all messages within 24 hours.

Please enable JavaScript in your browser to complete this form.

Work with us online

E-MAIL

asiliuhaiafrika@gmail.com

PHONE

+49 174 9735601
+254720828560

LOCATION

Nanyuki Kenya (P.O. BOX 62 - 10400, Nanyuki)

Twitter Instagram Youtube Facebook

Reach Out to Us Today!"

Were here to answer your questions and collaborate with you to make a difference. Whether youre interested in learning more about our projects or contributing to our mission, feel free to contact us:

Thank you so much for staying in touch

item.title: Elementor Page #4351
item.dc:creator: m@anuu
item.content:encoded:
ASILI UHAI AFRIKA

Welcome to Asili Uhai Afrika

At AUA, we are passionate about restoring Africas natural beauty and empowering communities through impactful reforestation and afforestation projects. By planting native trees, fostering biodiversity, and promoting sustainable development, we are creating a brighter and greener future for generations to come.

Join us in transforming landscapes, empowering farmers, and making a lasting differencebecause together, we can be Natures Best Friend.

item.title: Projects
item.dc:creator: m@anuu
item.content:encoded:
Projects

Tree Planting Initiatives
Description: Our primary focus is on reforestation and afforestation through the planting of local and native tree species. Each rainy season, we aim to plant as many trees as possible at the start of each rainy season.

Impact: This initiative not only restores ecosystems but also enhances biodiversity and provides economic benefits to local farmers through agroforestry practices.


Agroforestry Programs
Description: We integrate tree planting with agriculture by collaborating with local farmers. This involves planting fruit trees alongside traditional crops to create sustainable agroforestry systems.

Impact: These programs help improve food security, provide additional income sources for farmers, and promote sustainable farming practices.


Community Engagement and Training
Description: We engage local communities from the beginning of each project. This includes raising seedlings, participating in planting activities, and receiving training on tree care and maintenance.

Impact: By involving locals, we foster a sense of ownership and responsibility for the environment, which is crucial for the long-term success of our initiatives.


Monitoring and Maintenance
Description: After planting, we implement a monitoring system involving local rangers and community members to ensure the survival and health of the trees.

Impact: Regular inspections help maintain tree growth and foster community involvement in environmental stewardship.


Future Projects
Expanding Our Reach: Plans to increase our planting capacity and engage more communities across Kenya.
Research and Development: Collaborating with universities for research on the best practices in reforestation and agroforestry.

How to Get Involved
Volunteer Opportunities: We invite volunteers to join our planting events and training sessions.
Partnerships: Organizations and individuals interested in collaborating with us on future projects are welcome to reach out.

item.title: AUA fies
item.dc:creator: m@anuu
item.content:encoded:
Projects

From $2

Leaders in Action

Reforestation efforts

Community chiefs leading by example in reforestation efforts. Their active participation reflects the importance of local leadership in fostering environmental sustainability and inspiring communities to join the fight against deforestation. Together, we are planting a legacy of hope and renewal for future generations.

Donate
From $2

Planting together for greener tommorow

Restoring Environment

Two individuals working hand in hand to restore the environment, showcasing the power of collaboration and shared responsibility. Every tree planted brings us one step closer to a healthier planet and a sustainable future for all

Donate
From $2

United for Greener Future

A remarkable group of over 30 individuals coming together to take action for the environment. This collective tree-planting effort symbolizes the power of unity and shared responsibility in combating the effects of deforestation and climate change. Each tree planted represents hope, resilience, and the promise of a restored ecosystem that will benefit future generations. Through teamwork and dedication, these individuals are not just planting trees but laying the foundation for a sustainable future. Their efforts remind us that real change begins with people, and together, we can create a healthier, greener world for all.

Donate

Work with us

Send us a message to discuss your needs. I always reply within 24 hours.

Donate

Contact Us

Email: asiliuhaiafrika@gmail.com

Phone: +491749735601 | +254720828560

Location: P.O. Box 62-10 400 Nanyuki, Kenya

A remarkable group of over 30 individuals coming together to take action for the environment. This collective tree-planting effort symbolizes the power of unity and shared responsibility in combating the effects of deforestation and climate change. Each tree planted represents hope, resilience, and the promise of a restored ecosystem that will benefit future generations. Through teamwork and dedication, these individuals are not just planting trees but laying the foundation for a sustainable future. Their efforts remind us that real change begins with people, and together, we can create a healthier, greener world for
